name: @sylphx/gust
description: High-performance HTTP server framework for Bun and Node.js with native Rust acceleration

rules.title: Use createApp for applications
rules.description: Always use createApp() to define routes and middleware. It creates a stateless app that can be used with any server.
rules.example: const app = createApp({ routes: [...], middleware: cors() })

rules.title: Use serve for native performance
rules.description: Use serve() from @sylphx/gust for native Rust acceleration (220k+ req/s). For serverless, use app.fetch directly.

rules.title: Use response helpers
rules.description: Use json(), text(), html(), redirect() instead of constructing responses manually.

rules.title: Use compose for middleware
rules.description: Use compose() to combine middleware (right-to-left). For route-specific middleware, wrap the handler.

rules.title: Path parameters are typed
rules.description: Path parameters from :param are automatically typed in ctx.params.

rules.title: Use validate for input validation
rules.description: Use validate() middleware with built-in schema validators (object, string, email, etc.).

rules.title: JWT auth is built-in
rules.description: Use jwtAuth() for protected routes. Use createJwt() and verifyJwt() for token management.

rules.title: SSE uses generators
rules.description: Use sse() with async generators for Server-Sent Events.

rules.title: Portable apps use @sylphx/gust-app
rules.description: For serverless/edge, import from @sylphx/gust-app and use app.fetch with any runtime.
rules.example: Bun.serve({ fetch: app.fetch }); export default { fetch: app.fetch }

folders.description: Documentation website with guides and API reference
Main package - re-exports app and server
Stateless app framework - routes, middleware, validation
Rust-powered HTTP server - WebSocket, SSE, streaming
